title: Under Secretary for Political Affairs to visit Sri Lanka
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Under Secretary for Political Affairs of the US Department of State Victoria Nuland is expected to visit Sri Lanka for a two day visit on Tuesday (22) a government statement said.
Nuland oversees regional and bilateral policy issues at the Department of State.
The statement said, during the visit, the Under Secretary is scheduled to call on President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, meet Foreign Minister G L Peiris and Foreign Secretary Jayanath Colombage.
“Minister Peiris and Under Secretary Nuland will co-chair the fourth session of the Sri Lanka-US Partnership Dialogue at the Foreign Ministry on Wednesday (23).
“In addition, Under Secretary Nuland is scheduled to visit the Colombo Port and meet the business community and civil society,” the statement said.

The Sri Lanka-US Partnership Dialogue was last held in 2019 in Washington DC which was held to review bilateral relations and explore avenues to further strengthen the cooperation and partnership between Sri Lanka and the United States.

“The Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asian Affairs of the US Department of State, Donald Lu and the Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Indo-Pacific Security Affairs Amanda Dory will accompany Under Secretary Nuland on the visit, the statement added.

Relations between Sri Lanka and the US have received renewed focus after the US joined a United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) core group of countries on Sri Lanka’s human rights record and also over a controversial energy deal. (Colombo/Mar22/2022)
